definition: Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: Hannibal defeated the Romans in 216 BC.
sentences.chinese: 汉尼拔于公元前216年打败了罗马军。

sentences.english: Rehearsals, as you see, are under way, for a new production of Chalumeau's "Hannibal".
sentences.chinese: 诸位请看，我们正在彩排夏卢莫的新剧《汉尼拔》。

sentences.english: Lady Murasaki helps Hannibal to heal.
sentences.chinese: 穆拉莎奇帮助汉尼拔恢复了健康。

sentences.english: Let us sell the field on which Hannibal is encamped.
sentences.chinese: 让我们把汉尼拔驻军的营地卖了吧。

sentences.english: By the side of the general is his little son hannibal, now nine years of age .
sentences.chinese: 元帅旁边是他的小儿子汉尼拔，当时年方九岁。

sentences.english: At this time in the war Rome was as afraid of Hasdrubal as it was Hannibal.
sentences.chinese: 这在罗马引起了恐慌，罗马人害怕他是第二个汉尼拔。

pinyin: Ya4 li4 shan1 da4 Da4 di4

definition: the Franks (Germanic people who arrived in Europe from 600 AD and took over France)
band of mounted bandits in Manchuria (archaic)
Loki, god of fire and mischievous destroyer in Norse mythology
